'''Jonathan Hyde''' (born 21 May 1948) is an Australian-born English actor, well known for his roles as [[J. Bruce Ismay]], the managing director of the [[White Star Line]] in ''[[Titanic (1997 film)|Titanic]]'', Egyptologist Allen Chamberlain in ''[[The Mummy (1999 film)|The Mummy]]'' and Sam Parrish/Van Pelt, the hunter in ''[[Jumanji (film)|Jumanji]]''. He is married to the Scottish soprano [[Isobel Buchanan]]. They have two daughters, one of whom is the actress [[Georgia King]].
Hyde was born in [[Brisbane]], Queensland. He is a member of the [[Royal Shakespeare Company]]. Among other roles, he played Ferdinand in a 1985 production of [[John Webster]]'s ''[[The Duchess of Malfi]]''. He graduated from the [[Royal Academy of Dramatic Art]] and is an Associate Member there. He was also an original cast member of ''[[Not the Nine O'Clock News]]'', the first series of which was pulled from broadcast because of the [[United Kingdom general election, 1979|General Election of 1979]]. Hyde has been in numerous films including ''[[The Contract (2006 film)|The Contract]]'', ''[[The Curse of King Tut's Tomb]]'', ''[[Land of the Blind (film)|Land of the Blind]]'', ''[[The Tailor of Panama]]'', ''[[Sherlock Holmes and the Case of the Silk Stocking]]'', ''[[Eisenstein (film)|Eisenstein]]'', ''[[Anaconda (film)|Anaconda]]'' and ''[[Richie Rich (film)|Richie Rich]]''.
He appeared in the 1989 BBC miniseries ''Shadow of the Noose'' in which he played the famous barrister [[Edward Marshall Hall]]. He has also appeared in several television mysteries, including ''[[Sherlock Holmes (1984 TV series)|The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes]]'' starring [[Jeremy Brett]], and ''[[Midsomer Murders]]''.
In 2007, Hyde played Dr. Dorn in [[Anton Chekhov|Chekhov's]] ''[[The Seagull]]'' and the Earl of Kent in ''[[King Lear]]'' for the [[Royal Shakespeare Company|RSC]] in a repertory company that included [[Ian McKellen]], [[Frances Barber]], [[Romola Garai]], [[William Gaunt]] and [[Sylvester McCoy]]. Both plays toured together internationally, before taking up residence in the [[New London Theatre]]. The final performance was on 12 January 2008. He reprised his role of Kent in the 2008 television film of ''[[King Lear (2008 TV film)|King Lear]]''.
In the final series of BBC's popular series [[Spooks]], Hyde plays Ilya Gavrik, a Russian Minister.
Hyde will appear as [[Lionel Logue]] in the UK touring production of [[The King's Speech]] in 2012.
